title.narrative: 1.2.MATERNAL AND NEWBORN PACKAGES

description.narrative: 1.2 By 2016, coverage and quality of maternal and new-born care interventions increased in programme areas (16 selected counties) with emphasis on population groups with low coverage (FA-1 & OT-07).2011 - 2013: By 2015, increased coverage and quality of maternal and newborn intervention packages, including antenatal care, skilled birth attendance and emergency obstetric care, with emphasis on population groups with low coverage leve ls (compared to national average) (FA-1 & OT-07)., which contributes to Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome-1: By 2016, access, delivery and utilization of quality basic Health Services improved for children and women at national and sub-national levels with emphasis on low coverage areas.2011-2013: Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: government strengthened to increase access to, delivery and utilization of quality basic health services for children and women.

sector.narrative: Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.2 By 2016, coverage and quality of maternal and new-born care interventions increased in programme areas (16 selected counties)with emphasis on population groups with low coverage (FA-1 & OT-07).2011 - 2013: By 2015, increased coverage and quality ofmaternal and newborn intervention packages, including antenatal care, skilled birth attendance and emergency obstetric care, withemphasis on population groups with low coverage leve ls (compared to national average) (FA-1 & OT-07).

description.narrative: UNICEF supported maternal and neonatal interventions: 96 per cent of births received skilled care and over 98 per cent of pregnant women received two doses of Td vaccine and emergency obstetric care. More than 90 per cent of pregnant women in 25 county hospitals benefited from newborn care services. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2017

title.narrative: Percentage of County hospitals providing Comprehensive Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care.
Peccentage of pregnant women recived 4 quality ante-natal care (BP, blood and urine test) at least four times during pregnancy).
Percentage of births attended by skilled health personnel.
Percentage of pregnant women received 2 doses of TT vaccine.
Policy on Focused Antenatal Care has been developed, adopted and implemented
